results.title: I heard the owl call my name
results.brief_description: Father Brian (Tom Courtenay), a young Anglican priest, is unaware that he is dying of leukemia when he begins a mission into the majestic solitude of British Columbia. Sharing the joys and sorrows of a once proud Indian tribe, Father Brian learns enough of life to be ready to die, peacefully and with dignity. So when, on a cold and wintry evening he hears the owl call his name, he is prepared. In what is, without doubt, a simple yet powerful tale, Tom Courtenay’s stunning performance as a man doomed to die, is both touching and dramatic. The film rates as one of those rare presentations that packs a dramatic wallop that is not easily forgotten. Based on Margaret Craven’s novel of the same title.

results.title: The Mambo kings
results.creator_credit: Arne Glimcher, Arnon Milchan, Alcor Films, La Studia Canal, Regency Enterprises and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: It is the early fifties and with a suitcase full of songs and hearts full of passion, two brothers leave Cuba and come to America in search of their Dream. They start a band and play the Mambo, Samba and Cha-cha in a nightclub every night. This is the story of their quest for show business fame based on the Pulitzer Prize winning “The Mambo Kings play Songs of Love” by Oscar Hjuelos. This film abounds with exciting Latin American music and fascinating footage of the “I Love Lucy” show is matched with footage of the brothers when their big break arrives. Stars Armand Assante and Antonio Banderas.

results.title: The Stolen children = Il Ladro di bambini
results.creator_credit: Gianni Amelio, Angelo Rizzoli, Alia Film, Erre Produzioni and Raidue
results.brief_description: Two children, Rosetta and Giusseppe are victims of a child prostitution ring. After their mother is arrested, they are taken by Antonio the Carabiniere from the North to the South of Italy, looking for an orphanage that will take the children. The children have learned to trust no-one, not even each other, yet this journey with Antonio begins to break down the barriers that the children have always had to maintain. This very special, rewarding film was the winner of the Grand Jury Prize at the 1992 Cannes Film Festival and has been universally hailed as one of the finest Italian films released in many years. Stars Enrico Lo Verso, Valentina Scalici and Giuseppe Ieracitano.

results.title: Everybody's fine = Stanno tutti bene
results.creator_credit: Giuseppe Tornatore, Angelo Rizzoli, ERRE, Les Films Ariane, Sovereign Pictures and TF1 Films productions
results.brief_description: Matteo Scuri (Marcello Mastroianni) is a gentle warm-hearted widower and the proudest father of all in Italy. With his five children all successes in their own right, Matteo can’t help but boast about them to everyone he meets - including strangers! For years his children, scattered throughout Italy, have paid an annual visit on his birthday. But this year, they are unable to make it. Disappointed and feeling a little lost, Matteo decides to pay his children a surprise visit, and reunite them all for another family celebration. As he crosses a noisy and crazy country, the trip becomes a revelation as he discovers the real lives of the children he thought he knew. A chronicle of one man’s haunting journey of discovery, this film touches all emotions - a truly captivating cinematic experience from director Giuseppe Tornatore. English subtitles.

results.title: Hullabaloo over Georgie & Bonnie's pictures
results.creator_credit: James Ivory, Ismail Merchant, London Weekend Television and Merchant Ivory Productions
results.brief_description: The “hullaballo” in question is a leisurely, but fiercely determined race for possession of a priceless collection of rare Indian pictures. It’s enlivened by a romp through royal India…a world of princes, palaces, tourists, precious art objects and their wheelers and dealers… but more than this, the film gives us rare insight into the lasting values of life. The films boasts a wonderful screenplay by Ruth Prawer Jhabuala. Stars Peggy Ashcroft.

results.title: Dangerous liaisons
results.creator_credit: Stephen Frears, Hank Moonjean, Norma Heyman, Lorimar Film Entertainment, NFH Productions and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Valmont (John Malkovich) can’t resist. Wealthy, alluring Merteuil (Glenn Close) has challenged him to seduce the beautiful and very proper Madame de Tourvel (Michelle Pfeiffer), a task involving Valmont’s favourite pastimes, love and revenge. What’s more, Merteuil offers herself as the ultimate prize. So let the game begin. The unspoken rules to this contest of sinful pleasures are second-nature to rakish Valmont. Lie, cheat, deceive, debauch, double-cross, betray. But do not fall in love. The story comes from the frequently banned 1782 novel “Les Liaisons Dangereuses” written by Choderlos De Laclos, and was transformed into an international stage success by Christopher Hampton who then fashioned the play into an Oscar winning movie script. The luxurious setting is pre-French Revolution, but the characters could step into the dog-eat-dog nineties without skipping a beat.

results.title: The Commitments
results.creator_credit: Allan Parker, Lynda Myles, Roger Randall-Cutler and Sovereign Pictures
results.brief_description: Alan Parker’s tale of an Irish working class band’s odyssey is a strident belt-you-in-the-mouth delight. On a mission to bring soul to Dublin plus fame and fortune for himself, Jimmy Rabbitte transforms a motley bunch of misfits and raw talent into ‘the hardest working band in the world’, THE COMMITMENTS, billing them as the ‘saviours of Soul’. Based on the cult novel by Roddy Doyle and set to a scorching soul soundtrack. This film pulsates with raw energy, colourful dialogue, working class struggles and big time dreams - it’s a knockout.

results.title: Chaplin
results.creator_credit: Richard Attenborough, Mario Kassar and Carolco Pictures
results.brief_description: Brilliant, enigmatic, beloved, Charlie Chaplin made more people laugh than anyone else in history. His story and the story of filmmaking - inextricably linked together - are brought to the screen in Richard Attenborough’s modern masterpiece. This truly magnificent film starring one of the finest casts from the world of film including: Dan Aykroyd, Geraldine Chaplin, Anthony Hopkins, Marisa Tomei, Kevin Kline and James Woods. This is the story of how this master entertainer survived a deprived and tragic childhood and then transformed such poverty into humour which everyone, everywhere cherished.

results.title: Desert hearts
results.creator_credit: Donna Deitch and Desert Heart Productions
results.brief_description: Set in Nevada 1959, Helen Shaver is Vivian Bell, a repressed college professor from New York who arrives at a ranch in Reno for a temporary stay to obtain a divorce. Anticipating a quiet stay reading and preparing for the academic year she finds herself distracted and drawn to the ranch owner’s fiery step-daughter Cay Rivvers (Patricia Charbonneau). As their friendship develops and Vivian’s restrained and latent passion is unleashed, their lesbian relationship becomes an act of defiance against the accepted rules of society. The memorable soundtrack includes songs by Patsy Cline and other performers of the late 50’s. Based on the novel “Desert of the Heart” by Jane Rule.

results.title: Desert bloom
results.creator_credit: Eugene Corr, Michael Hausman and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Set in Las Vegas at the time of the first atom bomb tests in 1951, this powerful drama examines the life of a struggling middle-class Nevada family, seen through the eyes of 13 year old Rose Chismore (Annabeth Gish). Finding life difficult with her war-scarred father (Jon Voight), Rose forms a close bond with her flamboyant Aunt Starr (Ellen Barkin) whose friendship comes at a critical time.
